intro: Oxypetalum arnottianum var. brachystephanum, commonly known as the short-stephanum oxypetalum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, preferring well-drained sandy soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in some areas.
